newsitem.title: SOUTH KOREA: Dacom '97 net seen at 21.8 bln won.
newsitem.headline: Dacom '97 net seen at 21.8 bln won.

text.p: South Korea's Dacom Corp forecast on Wednesday its after-tax profit would rise to 21.8 billion won in calendar 1997 from 15.2 billion won a year earlier.
A company official said rising turnover in the areas of personal computer networks and long-distance phone services would contribute to the profit increase.
The nation's second long-distance phone service provider forecast its turnover would increase to 745 billion won this year from 621 billion a year earlier.

The company official said sales from the long-distance call service would rise by 26.7 percent to 220 billion won this year. He said Dacom's share of phone services would rise to 15 percent at end-1997 from eight percent early this year.
"We will reach the break-even point in phone services this year," he said.
Dacom launched its domestic long distance service last year, but did not win as large a market share as it had expected.
A surge in turnover from the value-added PC network service would be the major reason behind the profit increase.
Dacom said sales from the network business would rise 66.6 percent to 88.5 billion won this year.
Subscribers to its network business grew to 750,000 in May, 1997 from 21,000 in 1996. The company forecast the number would jump to three million by the year 2000.
